required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Usability of Subcutaneous Auto-injector of CT-P17 in Patients With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Open-label, Single-arm, Multiple-dose Study to Evaluate Usability of Subcutaneous Auto-injector of CT-P17 in Patients With Moderate to Severe Active Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical trial to evaluate Usability of Subcutaneous Auto-injector of CT-P17 in Patients With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis

primary_outcome.measure: Usability of the Auto-injector (AI) at Week 4
primary_outcome.description: The usability of CT-P17 Auto Injector is measured by participant using PRE- and POST-Self-injection Assessment Questionnaire (SIAQ) modules. The PRE-SIAQ module is a 7-item questionnaire and the POST-SIAQ module is a 27-item questionnaire that assesses feelings about injections, self-image, self-confidence (regarding self-administration), pain and skin reactions before after injection. Participants rated each item of the SIAQ on a 5-point (or 6-point) semantic Likert-type scal. (each item graded on a 5-point scale). [Scores were transformed to Rate between 0 (worst) to 10 (best)]

secondary_outcome.description: The number of successful self-injection are assessed by Observer using Self-Injection Assessment Checklist (SIAC) module by checking self-injection requirements are met.
The percentage of successful self-injection are assessed by Observer using Self-Injection Assessment Checklist (SIAC) module by checking self-injection requirements are met.

The usability of CT-P17 Auto Injector is measured by participant using PRE- and POST-Self-injection Assessment Questionnaire (SIAQ) modules. The PRE-SIAQ module is a 7-item questionnaire and the POST-SIAQ module is a 27-item questionnaire that assesses feelings about injections, self-image, self-confidence (regarding self-administration), pain and skin reactions before after injection. Participants rated each item of the SIAQ on a 5-point (or 6-point) semantic Likert-type scal. (each item graded on a 5-point scale). [Scores were transformed to Rate between 0 (worst) to 10 (best)]

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the CT-P17 Auto Injector with the mean change from baseline in Disease Activity Score in 28 Joints (DAS28-C-reactive protein [CRP]) [The larger the score decreases, the better the patient's status goes]
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in Disease Activity Score, DAS28 (C-reactive protein [CRP]) upto Week 24

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of the CT-P17 Auto Injector with the mean change from baseline in Disease Activity Score in 28 Joints (DAS28- erythrocyte sedimentation rate [ESR]) [The larger the score decreases, the better the patient's status goes]
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in Disease Activity Score, DAS28 (erythrocyte sedimentation rate [ESR]) upto Week 24.
Incidence of Adverse Events (AEs) assessed reported by investigator

intervention.description: Subcutaneous Injection of Adalimumab 40mg once every two weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female patient aged 18 to 70 years, inclusive.
- Patient must be able and willing to self-administer subcutaneous (SC) injections via auto injector (AI).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who has previously received investigational or licensed product; biologic or targeted synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis and/or a tumor necrosis factor (TNF) Î± inhibitor for any purposes.
- Patient who has allergies to any of the excipients of study drug or any other murine and human proteins, or patient with a hypersensitivity to immunoglobulin products.
